style.name: American-Style Pale Ale
style.description: American pale ales range from deep golden to copper in color. The style is characterized by fruity, floral and citrus-like American-variety hop character producing medium to medium-high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma. Note that the "traditional" style of this beer has its origins with certain floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American hop varietals. One or more of these hop characters is the perceived end, but the perceived hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. American pale ales have medium body and low to medium maltiness. Low caramel character is allowable. Fruity-ester flavor and aroma should be moderate to strong. Diacetyl should be absent or present at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Mill House Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Mill House Brewing Company opened as a brewpub in November 2013, in the Historic Mill House that has, for many years, been a watering hole and restaurant for the citizens of Poughkeepsie and the surrounding areas. The rehabilitated 1820’s brick house is now home to a 7 Barrel single-infusion system, built by Portland Kettle Works, along side a restaurant that seats over 250+ guests. Mill House Brewing Company has long focused on creating Local Craft Beers, with World Class Flavor.  At MHBC, where art & science meet, it’s important to understand our humble beginnings. 
Jamie Bishop and Lawrence Stock, are Two best friends brewing better beer.  From the Days in the basement of Jamie’s Hudson Valley home, to brewing over 600 barrels in the first year at MHBC, the two have continually focused on creating beers that are not only seasonally varied, but have classic integrity. An American Brewers Guild graduate in 2014, Mill House Brewing Company continually strives to create better beer, with in-house lab testing, water recipes, and house yeast strain cultivation.  They are true masters of their craft, brewing 25 uniquely different beers to date, with many more on the way!
Mill House Brewing Company has enjoyed much success since 2013.  The Brewpub was awarded Top 100 Hot Spots in American from OpenTable dining, Hudson Valley Magazine Best New Restaurant and Bar Menu, Hudson River Craft Brew Fest “People’s Choice” in 2013/2014, as well as countless other accolades.  With the brewer owners, restaurateur partners Chris and Daniel Crocco, and boutique development firm RL Baxter Building, the team looks to spread their wings even more in 2015.  With a 20bbl brewhouse on the horizon this year, Mill House Brewing Company is dedicated to bringing Local Craft, and World Class Flavor to the world.  Prost!

breweries.name: Vierling Restaurant & Marquette Harbor Brewery
breweries.description: In December 1995, the Vierling became one of Michigan’s first brew pubs with the addition of a five barrel micro-brewing system.  The brew equipment, direct from Budapest, Hungary is configured to produce some of the finest ales and lagers in 155 gallon hand-crafted batches.  The relatively small sized batches of beer insures a fast product turn-over which enables the Vierling to serve the freshest beer possible with a multitude of varieties.

breweries.name: Beach Chalet Brewery and Restaurant
breweries.description:
The Beach Chalet Brewery & Restaurant is located above the Golden Gate Park Visitor's Center which features the amazing and historic WPA frescoes created by Lucien Labaudt in the 1930's. The artwork captures the flavor of San Francisco in that era in a style of the Arts and Crafts movement – a must see for fans of the style and for anyone who wants a taste of the strange and incredible period in which the WPA allowed art projects like this to exist during such hard times.

Upstairs you will find the Beach Chalet Brewery & Restaurant. It was developed by Gar and Lara Truppelli and Timon Malloy in 1997 after the Chalet had sat vacant for 17 years. To remodel and restore this historic building to its former glory so it could be a landmark to be enjoyed by future generations as well as to create a space for their restaurateurs’ dreams, they brought Heller Manus Architects onboard to help make their dreams a reality.

Today thousands of guests enjoy the Modern American Cuisine menu and hand crafted ales. The Beach Chalet offers a full bar, abundant free parking and a breathtaking ocean view. Bay Area residents and visitors find the Beach Chalet to be a wonderful San Francisco experience while visiting Golden Gate Park and Ocean Beach. Join us and find out why the Beach Chalet is your kind of place.

breweries.name: Rochester Mills Beer Company
breweries.description: The Rochester Mills Beer Co. opened in 1998 in Downtown Rochester. Located in the historic Western Knitting Mill, the brewery is located on Water Street, just two blocks east of Main Street. Preserving the original character of the building, the brewery features original hardwood floors, columns, beams and exposed brick walls. The menu features a broad selection of eclectic American cuisine, all prepared with the freshest ingredients. From delectable appetizers, fresh salads, pizzas and pastas to delicious entrees and unique sandwiches, the menu has something for everyone and a kids menu is available. Special amenities include an outdoor patio, pool tables,  Greenhorn Music Night every Thursday starting at 9pm, and live entertainment every Friday, and Saturday nights starting at 10pm. The Martini Lounge is available for private parties.

data.name: PMX
data.description: To label a beer as extraordinary is to trust its ingredients from the start. Crystal filtered artesian water, whole hops, and the choicest malted barley create this American-style pale ale we are pleased to call PMX. The character of an American Pale Ale varies from region to region and is dependent upon the ingredients used. In ours, one can expect harmony between malt and hops without dominating tastes of sweet or bitter. We bottle condition this beer, which is a secondary fermentation provide a natural carbonation and a classic tribute to historic brewing methods.

breweries.name: Southern Tier Brewing Company
breweries.description: Southern Tier Brewing Company was founded in 2004 by Phineas DeMink and Allen Yahn with the vision of bringing small batch brewing back to a region rich in brewing tradition. In 2003 Skip and Phin purchased the defunct Old Saddle Back Brewing Co. in Pittsfield, Massachusetts. All the equipment was removed and brought back to Lakewood, New York and set up at its new 10,000 square foot home, The Southern Tier Brewing Company. The Brewery began operations in February 2004 distributing regionally. By 2005 sales covered the majority of the New York State and the eastern half of Pennsylvania. In the beginning their two Flagship brands were a Pilsner and Mild Ale. Oh yeah they also brewed IPA! As it turned out the flagships were a flop and the IPA was a huge success. They next launched a line of seasonal beers which have gained great success. Since the beginning, Southern Tier has experienced steady growth, currently distributing to over 25% of the United States. Multiple expansions have been made to keep up with demand and the brewery continues to be innovative by producing new products.  Keep a look out for new products coming to stores near you.

breweries.name: Center of the Universe Brewing
breweries.description:
Center of the Universe Brewing Company (or COTU for short), will be opening on November 16th. COTU began back in 2009 when Chris Ray and his brother Phil began brewing beer in their houses. The hobby turned into an obsession, and the obsession has led them to open up a craft brewery in Ashland, Virginia. Located in the heart of Central Virginia, it is affectionately known as “The Center of the Universe”. COTU will be brewing an assortment of ales using only whole ingredients, while sticking to the traditional all-natural method of brewing beer.

The meaning of “Center of the Universe” is important to the founders of COTU. With so much emphasis today on globalization and the lack of corporate stewardship, COTU wanted to be a company that truly embraces the local community. “Center of the Universe,” to COTU, is taking pride in where you live and respecting the people with whom you interact. We believe it is our responsibility to understand and appreciate how our actions affect the community that supports us.

At Center of the Universe Brewing Company it all revolves around the beer and the people who enjoy it.

data.name: Point Break Pale Ale
data.description: A relative of Bitter and I.P.A., Pale ale has a bright, golden color. This style is also known for it's crisp hop flavor, as well as its fruity aroma. Our Point Break goes heavy on Northwestern American hops, rounded out by rich malt flavors, followed by a creamy finish. Gold Medal, Northeastern Beer Festival. Unfiltered-55 I.B.U.s Cascade

breweries.name: Trinity Brewhouse
breweries.description:
Always fresh, always crisp.
Crafted with the finest quality hops from around the world, and filtered Scituate Reservoir water from right here in Little Rhody.

The beers, ales, porters and stouts available at the Brewhouse Pub are brewed on premises - ensuring a high quality product that is always satisfying and never flat.

Our Brewmaster takes great pride in providing our customers with the freshest beer in the city.
If we were any fresher...you'd slap us!

Stop by for a pint or two in house - or grab a Growler To Go and enjoy great Trinity Brewhouse Beer at your own leisure.

breweries.name: Stevens Point Brewery
breweries.description: The Stevens Point Brewery is steeped in a history that has transcended the trials of the Civil War, the Great Depression and Prohibition. More than 150 years later, the Stevens Point Brewery continues to successfully brew quality beer, just as the brewery’s founders, Frank Wahle and George Ruder, did in 1857. This undeniable endurance is a testament of why the Stevens Point Brewery, in Stevens Point, Wisconsin, is the 5th oldest continuously operating brewery remaining in the United States. Today, the Stevens Point Brewery is proud to be Wisconsin-owned and independently operated.

data.name: Pointers Pale Ale
data.description: This Kiwi take on an Australian style Pale Ale uses a unique blend of 5 NZ hops. The Wai-iti and Motueka hops star, creating the upfront burst of tropical fruit aroma, which reveal mandarin & peach on the lips. Cloudy and golden in colour, this brew blends Munich, Ale and Wheat malts to create a balanced yet crisp beer.

data.name: Poleeko Gold Pale Ale
data.description:
When the phrase “California Style Ale” is used, Poleeko Gold Pale Ale is the one that comes to mind. The golden color and generous use of Pacific Northwest hops establish a distinct style, separate from any domestic or European beers. Our honey-gold pale ale is crisp and clear, with an unusual lightness and dryness for such a full-flavored ale. The arousing abundance of hops adds both a floral bouquet and a lively, citrusy finish. It is excellent alone, or with full-flavored meals and spicy dishes.

Poleeko Gold Pale Ale was named the Regional Champion in the 2003 US Beer Tasting Championships Summer Competition, in the Golden Ale/Kolsch category, and has several other medals, as well. Click here to see the entire list.

As with all of our products, Poleeko Gold Pale Ale is never sterile filtered nor heat pasteurized, and should be stored in refrigeration. However, to fully enjoy its rich and complex flavor, it should be served between 40° and 45°F

Our tradition of carefully crafting inspired, flavorful, ales of the highest caliber has earned numerous awards, a loyal following, and our two-time placement among the World Beer Championships® as well as a 2011 Gold Medal at the GABF® for our Brother David's Double.

breweries.name: Kuhnhenn Brewing
breweries.description:
Founded in 1998, Kuhnhenn Brewing Company began as a homebrew supplies shop in the family's former hardware store while buildout on the brewery was taking place. 

The company has been producing countless award-winning beer, mead, and wine out of their 8-barrel brewery since 2001. In 2012, Kuhnhenn took home the Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup in the IPA category for their flagship offering, DRIPA, or Double Rice IPA.

The brewery  has expanded to capacity over the years, with only limited distribution in Michigan, New York City, and parts of Europe, in addition to taking part in festivals throughout the world. Construction is underway on a production brewery and second taproom in nearby Clinton Township, which will allow the brewery to get closer to meeting demand by increasing capacity more than 1500% overnight. 

Visit the brewery taproom for to-go sales of some of their award-winning products.

Our beers are never filtered or force carbonated. data.name: Poop Deck
data.description:
We know what you’re thinking. Go ahead and make all the punny jokes you want. We have. Of course that was after everyone was informed that the Poop Deck is simply a deck above the Captain’s Quarters in the aft of a ship.   
 
Don’t judge this beer by its name. It’s our brand-new Pale Ale release, a first from Diamond Knot!  Your basic Pale recipe consisting of 2-row pale malt, Cara-pils® Malt, Crystal malt and just a touch of flaked barley for some body.  Galena hops provide the body of the bitterness and super-alpha Apollo hops in the finish and dry-hop add a bright, citrusy hop flavor and aroma that’ll keep you coming back for more.

breweries.name: Diamond Knot Brewery & Alehouse
breweries.description:
Diamond Knot Brewing has been handcrafting great NW ales since 1994! 
 
With four convenient locations in Mukilteo, WA & Camano, WA we offer a unique dining experience along with our handcrafted beers.  Our original brewery & alehouse is located on the beautiful Puget Sound, and if you are looking to relax with the family, check out Diamond Knot Lincoln Ave for our family friendly calzone & pizza house.  At Lincoln Ave, you can enjoy a craft beer as your children can construct their own pizza right at the table.  If you are out exploring the islands, check out Diamond Knot Camano Lodge.  Or if you want to experience all the magic of craft beer, check out our Production Facility & Taproom. 

Explore the Diamond Knot and experience all we have to offer.

data.name: Poor Richard's Ale
data.description: In spite of the fact that Benjamin Franklin is constantly given credit for the quote “Beer is proof that God loves us and wants us to be happy”, this line does appear anywhere in Ben’s writing.  But I’m certain he felt this way about his favorite beverage. Brewed with corn and molasses, two common brewing ingredients in colonial times, Poor Richards Ale is a modern interpretation of a beer Ben might have drank in one of his favorite taverns.

breweries.name: Boscos Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Located in the historic Overton Square Entertainment District in Midtown Memphis, TN, Boscos believes in using only the freshest products and ingredients in our menu and in our hand-crafted beers.

Each restaurant's menu includes a variety of appetizers, salads, entrees or gourmet pizzas, baked in our brick oven. Signature items include fresh salmon baked on a cedar plank in Boscos brick oven, delicious double-cut pork chop, and a prime cut of steak cooked to perfection.

Boscos has been brewing award-winning handcrafted beers for over 22 years. That experience is evident in both the quality and variety of beers we offer, including the light-bodied, golden Famous Flaming Stone, the amber, crisp Bombay IPA, and our robust, full-bodied stouts and porters. Boscos has a beer to match everyone's tastes and to compliment every delicious dish.

Ölen du håller i din hand är en American Pale Ale (APA). När denna skapades i USA användes den lokalt odlade humlen. Detta gav rikliga toner av citrus. Som brukligt är i USA snålades det inte heller med dom väldoftande råvarorna.
Mycket är helt enkelt mer! 

"Jag brinner för att göra öl med tydlig humlekaraktär. Här har jag arbetat med humlesorterna Cascade och Citra som ger en fräsch citruston."

breweries.name: Mother Earth Brewing Company
breweries.description: Mother Earth Brewing Company is located on the corner of Heritage and North Street in Kinston NC. The facility includes the brewery itself, a bottling facility and Mother Earth’s corporate offices. In keeping with our company name, our rehabilitation of this old building is incorporating green technology, eco-friendly building materials and alternative energy sources wherever possible. Future plans include opening a tap room and offering tours of the brewery. Mother Earth’s four staple beers are a Munich Dunkel, an American IPA (organic), a Belgian Wit and a Kolsch, along with seasonal brews and oak aged beers. Mother Earth will distribute statewide in groceries, restaurants, and bars. Look for Mother Earth products soon..

breweries.name: Butternuts Beer and Ale
breweries.description:
Established in 2005, Butternuts Beer and Ale is located on a 120-acre farm in the beautiful Butternut Valley. Brewing in a renovated dairy barn, we brew American-style farmhouse ales with German, English and Belgian influences. Water is taken from our own springs and lends to our signature flavor. Our beer is made with natural ingredients and no pretense. We've been known to throw in a few spices or fruits into our beer. Our most popular beer, Pork Slap Pale Ale is sweet and malty, brewed with fresh ginger root. Heinnieweisse is a German-style weissebier with tart citrus and banana notes. For all our hopheads, Snapperhead is an American IPA with light spicy and earthy hop flavors. And don't forget about Moo Thunder American Stout with its espresso, dark chocolate, smoky flavor.
We change up the beer on draft pretty regularly, so stop by often. You can sample all our year-round brews, plus any specialty styles we have on draft. Take a tour of our brewery and learn about the brewing process, ingredients and history. Our beer is available for sale in 6-packs or cases and don't forget to bring your growler.

breweries.name: Valley Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Since 1853, El Dorado Brewing Company operated in California's Central Valley providing beer for the local residents of San Joaquin county. When the Prohibition Act was passed, the company ceased operations for a period of time but still maintained the recipes and brewing knowledge. In 1994, Kellie Jacobs re-established the operations under the name of Valley Brewing Company Inc. and set out to build Valley Brewing Company into the premier brewery that operated in years past.

Over a decade later, Valley Brewing Company has won numerous awards for various beers such as Uberhoppy, West Coast IPA, Luna Blanca and London Tavern. The London Tavern won a silver medal in the 2010 World Beer Cup and Uberhoppy just recently won another prestigious award in 2011. Valley Brewing Company and will continue it's focus on brewing the San Joaquin Valley's top beers and provide our loyal customers with not only award winning beer but bragging rights that they represent Valley Brew!

Come in and enjoy our award winning beers and enjoy the ambiance of our beautiful microbrewery located in Stockton, California. See you soon.

breweries.description:
In 1971, casting aside their stockbroker careers to become the bellwether personalities of the Denver restaurant industry in the 70s and 80s, the brothers built the Bull & Bush to kick start a list of successful restaurants.

Last but certainly not least, the pub is now also a brewery. Since brewing its first batch on New Year’s Day of 1997, the Bull & Bush brewing operation has become world renowned for its great tasting and innovative creations. Master Brewer Gabe Moline’s brews have earned multiple accolades including the Best Beer in a Brewpub award in Westword‘s Best of Denver, multiple awards at the annual Denver-hosted Great American Beer Festival (GABF) and most recently the Bull and Bush’s “The Legend of the Liquid Brain Imperial Stout” was given the highest honor, a Gold award, at the World Beer Cup – the world’s largest commercial beer competition.

style.name: American-Style Pale Ale
style.description: American pale ales range from deep golden to copper in color. The style is characterized by fruity, floral and citrus-like American-variety hop character producing medium to medium-high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma. Note that the "traditional" style of this beer has its origins with certain floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American hop varietals. One or more of these hop characters is the perceived end, but the perceived hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. American pale ales have medium body and low to medium maltiness. Low caramel character is allowable. Fruity-ester flavor and aroma should be moderate to strong. Diacetyl should be absent or present at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Lumina Brewing Company
breweries.description: Lumina Brewing Company is dedicated to producing beer in small batches. We brew our beer right on premises. All of our beer is fresh with no preservatives. We specialize in brewing German and Bohemian Style Beer. We brew our European Style beer in accordance with the Bavarian Brewing Tradition of “Reinheitsgebot”, the German beer purity law of 1516. This means that nothing is added to the beer except yeast, hops, water and grain. All of our Bavarian Style Beer contains malt and hops from Germany. Our Brew masters have extensively traveled Germany and the Czech Republic and have visited many breweries to learn the art of old world style brewing.

breweries.name: Quaff On! Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Quaff: To drink heartily and with gusto!

At Quaff ON! Brewing Company, 'Gusto' is part of everything we do. Our hand-crafted beers reflect our passion for the brewer's art and our commitment to creating beers that excite and delight the quaffer's palette.
Quaff ON! Brewing Company was formed in 2012 in response to the demand for the iconic craft beers we developed at Big Woods Brewing Company, our brewpub located in the heart of Brown County Indiana. Why 'Quaff ON!'? Because from the day Big Woods threw open its doors in 2009, Quaff ON! has been the rallying cry, the toast, and the salutation of our loyal fans.
When Big Woods founders Jeff McCabe, Tim O'Bryan and Ed Ryan decided to create Quaff ON! Brewing Company, they had one Master Brewer in mind to take Busted Knuckle Ale, Hare Trigger IPA, Six Foot Blonde and Timid Virgin Pale to new heights and a larger market. That Brewer is Mark Havens, whose reputation as a talented and committed 'creator of craft beers' is well known. Mark came on board in time to lend a hand in the conversion of our 60 year old bowling alley into the Quaff ON! brewing facility.
Once Mark got the new brewery up and running and our original Big Woods recipes were in production, Mark began introducing new beers, including Yellow Dwarf Wheat, a hopped up wheat that begs to be quaffed and Sadie the Goat Brown Ale, a hearty homage to the substantial beers quaffed by river pirates 2 centuries ago.
Currently Quaff ON!'s beers are distributed all over Indiana. Look for us at your favorite watering hole and in the craft beer section at package stores throughout the state. If Quaff ON! is not served at your favorite place, send us a note and we'll get it in there! If you're travelling our way, stop in and see us in Brown County and visit us in Nashville at Big Woods Village where you can enjoy fine craft beer, great food and the best in local entertainment.

"Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." - William Shakespeare

data.name: Pour…Wait…Repeat
data.description: Named for the “proper” method to pour a beer from a bottle, Blank Slate’s incarnation of the American Wheat Beer style seems the perfect answer on an easy summer day.  Not your typical bland American Wheat Ale, this beer uses both Red and White Wheat Malt along with Oats and just a touch of Honey Malt to create a creamy malt backbone.  Late additions of Centennial and Willamette hops give this beer a smooth hop character that’s a little more aggressive than a lot of other wheat beers out there these days.

breweries.name: Blank Slate Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Blank Slate is one of the many new small craft breweries in the Cincinnati Ohio area. Launched in 2012 they are part of the growing renaissance of craft brewing in Cincinnati.

Blank Slate unlike many breweries, produce primarily seasonal brands. This means that many of the brands will be rotated several times throughout the year. This philosophy to forego the "flagship model" of beer branding and embrace the seasonal approach to beer brewing (and drinking) is a big part of the Blank Slate mantra.

breweries.description: Echo Brewing Company is a small family run brewery nestled between the towns of Firestone and Frederick in the heart of Colorado’s Carbon Valley.  Founded by twin brothers who have a passion for brewing the best beer possible.  Homebrewers of eight plus years they keep their brewing concept at Echo similar to their homebrewing history: brew one fine beer followed by another while sharing them with the local community.

data.name: Power & Light Pale
data.description:
Brewed with Pale and Pilsen malts, and just the right touch of Cascade hops, Power & Light is a crisp and refreshing take on the American Pale Ale. Power & Light is designed to be very sessionable - it finishes clean and dry with light lingering grapefruity hop notes. 

Inspired by Austin's iconic, art-deco Seaholm Power Plant, Power & Light has become a perennial favorite of craft beer drinkers across Texas. 

Power & Light was Gold at 2016 World Beer Cup in the Blonde Ale category, and 2014 Good Food Awards winner.

breweries.name: Independence Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Rob and Amy Cartwright embarked on their dream to brew flavorful, delicious beers for the people of Austin in October 2004. Armed with their love of beer, years of brewing experience, an intrepid spirit, and their trusty dog Jasper, they founded Independence Brewing Company.

Located in southeast Austin, amongst tech companies and warehouse park entrepreneurs, Independence Brewing is a true reflection of the creative energy and pioneering spirit that makes Austin great.

What started with a married couple and their dog, has blossomed into a talented crew who pours their hearts and soul into brewing beers we love to drink and share with friends.

data.name: Power Of Zeus
data.description: The Power of Zeus. An American pale ale as well balanced as our round little friend. We use Zeus hops from our field that are carefully guarded by Zeus the Toad--a loveable fellow who greeted us when we planted the first Zeus.  We dug the hole, and out he hopped--giving new meaning to the phrase "hoppy beer!" So raise a glass to the power of Zeus!

breweries.name: Mt. Begbie Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Mt. Begbie Brewing was founded by Bart and Tracey Larson. Their love of beer and the quest for mountain living lured them to move to Revelstoke to create the brewery in 1996. Bart has a Phd in nuclear physics, but he prefers to make beer not war, right here in Revelstoke. And Bart hasn't let all that education stop him from making great beer. In fact, he's managed to combine his scientific background with an artistic, if somewhat bohemian, flair for beermaking to create what The Globe and Mail and Vancouver Province newspapers have called some of the best suds around. 

Bart's brewery skills are complemented by Tracey's tenacious management and marketing skills. Tracey has a degree in biology; but she too is immersed in the brewing business. She probably comes closest to using skills learned in courses such as zoology when calling on remote bars to demo cold Begbies to rowdy, and thirsty, patrons. 

The brewery has seen expansion since it's beginnings. Most significantly, the brewery moved to a larger location downtown, in an old car dealership, which now includes a tasting area and retail space.

data.description: Sunny, gold colored ale, made with North American Pale, Crystal and a small amount of Wheat Malts. Bittering done with Palisades hops and rounded out with Cascade hops for a pleasant, floral aroma. Named after the Historic Folsom Landmark built in 1895.

breweries.name: Lockdown Brewing Co
breweries.description:
Welcome to Lockdown Brewing Co., the “Home of the Folsom Prison Brews.”  Lockdown Brewing Co. brews craft ales for the enjoyment of beer lovers of all levels from the true connoisseur to the weekend beer lover. 
The beers of Lockdown Brewing Co. are hand crafted with all natural ingredients without adjuncts such as cereal, rice or fillers. Our beers are superior because of the brewmaster's attention to detail, his complete love of brewing and the freshness of the beer.

The beers are named in the spirit of the history of Folsom, CA. Lockdown Brewing Co. exhibits the rich history of Folsom and the Folsom Prison through its identity and labeling.  Folsom was home to many firsts.  It was the home to the first Railroad in the West and the first city to transport electricity over the wire over several miles, 22 to be exact. The prison is California’s second oldest and has been made famous thru media like Johnny Cash’s “Folsom Prison Blues” and the movie "Walk the Line".

We invite you to sample our fine ales and enjoy the great taste and absorb the long history of Folsom.
